image.altText: A woman wearing a "no stadium" hat speaks at a microphone

props.synopsis: Senator Jacqui Lambie calls on the independents in Tasmania's upper house — who hold the fate of the Macquarie Point stadium in their hands — to "find the courage the premier can't" and stop the project.

title.children: Lambie calls on Tasmanian independents to 'block this stadium'

image.altText: A close up photo of a phone with dating apps like Tinder, Grindr and Bumble on the screen.

props.synopsis: A child safety advocate welcomes a recent decision to uphold a ban on a convicted child sex offender from two dating apps, which comes after the man tried to have the ban overturned.

title.children: 'The system is working': Tinder, Hinge ban for man convicted of possessing child abuse material

image.altText: Bundles of Australian bank notes, mostly in 50 dollar denominations, in clear plastic bags.

props.synopsis: Police say they were conducting a random breath test when they came across the cardboard box full of cash.

title.children: Tasmanian man charged after police find $1 million in his vehicle

image.altText: Three women in a gym, squatting while holding dumbbells. In between each woman is electrical tape marking physical distancing.

props.synopsis: Scientists have, for the first time, linked exercise with a particular protein in the blood that is associated with brain health.

title.children: Dementia risk can be lowered with vigorous exercise, study finds

image.altText: A large fern in a shop

props.synopsis: Thousands of native tree ferns are harvested from Tasmania's forests for export each year. Some say the trade saves ferns from destruction, while others accuse the industry of greenwashing.

title.children: Why Tasmanian ferns hundreds of years old are on sale in UK garden centres

image.altText: A man and a woman smile for a photo holding a film clapperboard

props.synopsis: After developing their skills across various aspects of filmmaking, participants in the Accessible Filmmaking Program spent a day on set bringing their vision to life.

title.children: Bus Stop Films giving young filmmakers with disabilities a chance

image.altText: a man presenting television weather wearing a Sydney swans scarf, next to a map of tasmania

props.synopsis: The iconic weather presenter retires after more than 40 years on air in Tasmania.

title.children: LISTEN: After 9,000 TV weather reports, what's next for Peter Murphy?

image.altText: Erika Kirk holds back tears as she speaks at a microphone in white suit.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says Charlie Kirk was a "martyr to American freedom", while his widow says she forgives his alleged assassin during a memorial to the right-wing activist.

title.children: 'I forgive him': Erika Kirk's emotional statement to husband's alleged assassin

image.altText: An older man and woman sit beside side by side inside with serious facial expressions. The woman holds a small brown dog.

props.synopsis: Older Australians entering the aged care system will have to pay for "non-clinical" services such as showers and help with medication under wide-ranging changes taking effect in November.

title.children: Older Australians to pay up to $50/hour for personal care like showers

image.altText: A fighter jet flies in the sky with a bit of orange-tinted cloud.

props.synopsis: President Donald Trump says he will defend the Baltic states if Russia intensifies hostilities following Moscow's incursion into Estonia's airspace in recent days.

title.children: Russian military plane in Baltic Sea airspace causes concern

image.altText: Long jetty with sun reflecting off the water

props.synopsis: With one of the nation's highest proportions of Airbnbs, some of WA's most popular tourist towns face a dilemma. Tourism is their biggest breadwinner — but with a housing crisis in full swing, short-term stays are pushing more and more locals away.

title.children: 'Literally no affordable housing': The holiday homes hollowing out towns

image.altText: Anthony Albanese close up, with Chris Bowen in background.

props.synopsis: The problem with an emissions reduction target is that its mere existence implies it is achievable and that if we do achieve it, we will be fine. The truth is more complex.

title.children: Farmland for forests may be the net zero trade-off

image.altText: An AI logo is shown in a conference

props.synopsis: It's estimated 30,000 people are working in the AI industry in Australia, and fanfare is growing with start-ups tapping into billions of dollars of venture capital. Yet there are concerns about hype and a lack of regulation.

title.children: AI is 'coming at us fast'. But what exactly is it being used for right now?

image.altText: Eddie has grey hair and a blue top looks off screen, grey stubble, looks worried, flowers behind him.

props.synopsis: Victorian pensioner Eddie Rushforth says he does not know whether his bowel cancer has returned because he cannot afford the cost of the scans.

title.children: 'Where does a pensioner get $550?' Man goes without cancer scans

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: RBA delivers upbeat economic assessment to parliament, but warns about the risks of a Chinese slowdown.

title.children: RBA says economy in cyclical upturn, ASX gains after record close on Wall Street — as it happened

image.altText: Matt Denny slips on the ground

props.synopsis: Matt Denny was one discus thrower who ended up slipping and sliding across the Tokyo National Stadium as heavy rain made the discus competition a farce.

title.children: 'Silly at this point': Pundits slam farcical end to discus finals

image.altText: Eleanor Patterson and Angelina Topic under an umbrella

props.synopsis: Eleanor Patterson did not come away with a medal at the 2025 World Athletics Championships. But by supporting Angelina Topić through a tough moment, she gained so much more.

title.children: How this beautiful moment made up for missing a medal for Aussie star

image.altText: A young woman wearing black sits in front of a white wall on a couch.

props.synopsis: Every night, thousands of Australian kids are homeless without an adult to look after them.

title.children: This program could be a blueprint for keeping kids off the streets

image.altText: Nicola Olyslagers holds up a Australia flag

props.synopsis: Nicola Olyslagers won a superb gold medal in a women's high jump that was twice suspended for torrential rain on the final day of the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

title.children: Olyslagers wins fantastic gold as rain hits final day

image.altText: A young man and an older man sit together in sporting stands

props.synopsis: The deal would see TikTok's American assets transferred from China's ByteDance to American owners.

title.children: Lachlan Murdoch involved in possible TikTok deal, Trump says

image.altText: A wind turbine bent over with low white clouds around it, tall grass in the foreground.

props.synopsis: After a wind turbine blade snapped in half during a storm, the NSW National Party has called for a safety audit into the renewable technology.

title.children: Wind turbine blade failure six months after installation 'a big shock'

image.altText: A man in a grey suit

props.synopsis: NSW Police issued a warrant for solicitor Abdul Saddik's devices earlier this year as part of a probe into his links to figures in Sydney's underworld.

title.children: Sydney lawyer fighting police warrant over gun, drug supply evidence

image.altText: Oscar Piastri of Australia and McLaren climbs out of his damaged car

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri's worst weekend of 2025 ended with a false start, then a lap one crash, but he retains a healthy championship lead after his teammate failed to capitalise.

title.children: Piastri crashes out of F1 grand prix with 'silly' mistake on lap one

image.altText: Security cameras on a pole behind a razor wire fence.

props.synopsis: NT police data show crime rates in the NT are moving in two directions, with violent crime increasing and property crime decreasing.

title.children: Here's what the latest police figures reveal about crime rates in the NT

image.altText: a burnt converted e-bike on a train platform after it caught fire

props.synopsis: The e-bikes posing a "higher fire risk" will be banned from trains after dozens of incidents were found to be linked to the battery technology powering them.

title.children: Commuters taking converted e-bikes on NSW trains, metro to face fines up to $1,110

image.altText: Protesters hold signs.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Filipinos marched in the capital to vent their anger over a ballooning scandal involving bogus flood-control projects believed to have cost taxpayers billions of dollars.

title.children: Thousands protest corruption in Philippines

image.altText: Large bottles of yellow cooking oil being filled at a factory.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of litres of used cooking oil is disposed of every year as a by-product of making some of Australia's favourite snacks, like chips — but one company is trialling a method to reduce waste.

title.children: Cooking oil turned into snack packaging in Australia-first trial

image.altText: Satellite imagery of a river mouth and surrounding coastal region showing a large brown plume

props.synopsis: Scientists have questioned the link between the 2022-23 floods and South Australia's ongoing harmful algal bloom, despite the state government listing it as one of the three primary causes.

title.children: Doubts raised over link between SA's algal bloom and Murray River flood

image.altText: Queensland Police generic 2025-06-23 10:06:00

props.synopsis: Police allege the woman defrauded four elderly residents at an aged care facility where she worked and used their bank details to make personal purchases.

title.children: Aged care employee charged after allegedly defrauding elderly residents

image.altText: A white jet flying at night over a city with lights on

props.synopsis: British fighter jets fly their first NATO air defence unit over Poland as part of a mission to bolster the Western alliance's defences following a Russian drone incursion this month.

title.children: UK fighter jets begin NATO air defence mission over Poland

image.altText: An adult hand cradles the feet of a baby.

props.synopsis: The race to advance gene editing tech continues, spurred on by starry-eyed Silicon Valley investors, entrepreneurs and even pronatalists. But it's still deeply controversial.

title.children: 'The potential to save trillions': The controversial future of gene editing

image.altText: Three men in cycling jerseys stand together with medals around their necks.

props.synopsis: Queenslander Jay Vine races to a silver medal in the men's time trial at the world road cycling championships in Rwanda.

title.children: Australia's Vine claims spectacular silver in time trial at cycling world champs

image.altText: GettyImages-2236562847

props.synopsis: Chelsea fans stand and applaud Australian superstar Sam Kerr in her long-awaited return to Kingsmeadow in the WSL.

title.children: Kerr earns standing ovation in long-awaited return to Kingsmeadow

image.altText: Patrick Cripps kisses the Brownlow Medal on stage

props.synopsis: The AFL's big night is here, as the league's best and fairest player is honoured with the Brownlow Medal. Here is everything you need to know about the big event.

title.children: Brownlow Medal 2025: How to follow, how it works and who might win
